pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.1.0: 81. The training rule on what is worn out
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.1.2: At that time Venerable Dabba the Mallian, who was the assigner of dwellings and the designator of meals,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.1.3: had a robe that was worn out.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.1.4: Just then the Order had obtained robe-cloth,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.1.5: and it gave it to Dabba.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.1.6: The monks from the group of six complained and criticized it,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.1.7: “The monks are diverting the Order’s requisites according to friendship.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.1.8: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.1.10: “How can the monks from the group of six give out robe-cloth together with a complete Order and then criticize it afterwards?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.1.11: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.1.14: Foolish men, how can you give out robe-cloth together with a complete Order and then criticize it afterwards?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.1.15: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.1.16: And, monks, this training rule should be recited thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.1.17: ‘If a monk gives out robe-cloth together with a complete Order and then criticizes it afterwards, saying, “The monks are giving out the Order’s requisites according to friendship,” he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.1.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a complete Order through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.1.7: belonging to the same community, staying within the same boundary.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.1.9: one of the six kinds of robe-cloth, but not smaller than what can be transferred.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.1.13: according to friendship, according to companionship, according to who one is devoted to, according to being a co-student, according to being a co-pupil.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.1.15: given to the Order, given up to the Order.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.1.17: robe-cloth, almsfood, a dwelling, and medicines; even a bit of bath powder, a toothbrush, or a piece of string.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.1.19: when robe-cloth has been given to someone who is fully ordained and who is the assigner of dwellings or the designator of meals or the distributor of rice-porridge or the distributor of fruit or the distributor of non-staple food or the distributor of minor requisites, and he has been agreed upon by the Order as such, then if a monk criticizes it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.2.1: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and he perceives it as legitimate, and he criticizes it when robe-cloth has been given, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.2.2: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but he is unsure if it is, and he criticizes it when robe-cloth has been given, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.2.3: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but he perceives it as illegitimate, and he criticizes it when robe-cloth has been given, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.2.4: If he criticizes it when another requisite has been given, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.2.5: When someone who is fully ordained is the assigner of dwellings or the designator of meals or the distributor of rice-porridge or the distributor of fruit or the distributor of non-staple food or the distributor of minor requisites, but he has not been agreed upon by the Order as such, and a monk criticizes it when robe-cloth or another requisite has been given to him, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.2.6: When someone who is not fully ordained is the assigner of dwellings or the designator of meals or the distributor of rice-porridge or the distributor of fruit or the distributor of non-staple food or the distributor of minor requisites, whether he has been agreed upon by the Order as such or not, and a monk criticizes it when robe-cloth or another requisite has been given to him, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.2.7: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but he perceives it as legitimate, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.2.8: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but he is unsure if it is, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.2.9: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and he perceives it as illegitimate, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.3.2: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.3.3: The eleventh rule, the training rule on what is worn out, is finished.
